content:
If you have an old set up on a different computer, you can access the stored passwords there - but your post doesn't indicate this.

So, you will need to contact your Email provider for a password reset - hopefully, you will have a secondary contact email to which they can send you the temporary password.
creator: frisée

content:
A folder index can be exported with the ImportExportTools NG add-on (see picture). The current version shows an error after the export, but the process does create the index (known bug).

https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/importexporttools-ng/

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/installing-addon-thunderbird
creator: sfhowes

content:
A separate secure mail key must be created for each PC with the account. Use the key in place of the account password wherever you're asked for a 'password'.

https://www.att.com/support/article/dsl-high-speed/KM1010523/
creator: sfhowes

content: If it's an IMAP account then you would need to go on to your web based email and delete them there. They will disappear from TB at that point so it's best you back up the ones you need into a folder of your making under the Local Folders.

content: if you're going from thunderbird on one computer to thunderbird on another, the passwords are copied within the folder if you copy the folders with windows file explorer. if not, you can click settings>privacy&security and then click savedpasswords and then show passwords to see passwords that thunderbird has stored. but, if these are app passwords (such as used by Gmail), they won't work on new computer.
creator: davidsk

content: that's really a gmail issue, not a thunderbird one. to do this, - export a csv file from the addressbook pane - in gmail, import the csv file.
creator: davidsk

content: please be very specific on what you want to do, since Thunderbird is an email client and Gmail is an email provider.

content: I believe deleting the global index file will do that (when thunderbird isn't running0. on restart, thunderbird rebuids it.
creator: davidsk

content: the purest way is to use windows file explorer and, when thunderbird is not running, to copy the abook.sqlite and history.sqlite from old profile and paste into new profile. OR, click tools>import>import from a file and follow the prompts to achieve the same.
creator: davidsk

content: folders are in alphabetic order generally. Accounts, however, can be realigned.

creator: Ansamb

content:
V Thunderbirde si vytvorte ďaľší účet - ten nový IMAP

Ak máte vo svojom účte POP správy alebo priečinky, ku ktorým by ste chceli pristupovať prostredníctvom účtu IMAP, jednoducho ich vyberte a presuňte myšou do účtu IMAP. V závislosti od počtu správ, ktoré presuniete, môže odovzdanie trvať niekoľko minút, hodín, dní. Buďte trpezliví.
creator: Ansamb

creator: davidsk

content:
“Sending failed. Message couldn’t be sent because the connection to the outgoing server SMTP timed out. Try again.”

If you search for the string "the connection to the outgoing server SMTP timed out" in the top right search field, there will be numerous articles with information about how to resolve this issue.

The most common solution is that Anti-Virus software needs to be switched off from scanning emails.

If the solutions offered don't work, please reply to the post and it will be relisted as in need of a solution.
creator: frisée

content: You can suggest that change here - https://connect.mozilla.org/
